info.name: Asset Service - Complete Consolidated API Collection
info.description:
Complete consolidated Postman collection for Asset Management Service, organized by controller structure.

**Controller-Based Organization (20 Controllers):**
1. AssetController - Asset CRUD, Search, Bulk, Complete Creation
2. CategoryController - Category management
3. SubCategoryController - SubCategory management
4. MakeController - Make management
5. ModelController - Model management
6. VendorController - Vendor management
7. OutletController - Outlet management
8. ComponentController - Component management
9. UserLinkController - User linking, Master Data, Need Your Attention
10. AssetWarrantyController - Warranty operations
11. AssetAmcController - AMC operations
12. DocumentController - Document upload/management
13. FileDownloadController - File download operations
14. ComplianceController - Compliance validation, status, violations, reports, metrics
15. ComplianceRuleController - Compliance rules management
16. EntityTypeController - Entity type management
17. StatusController - Status management
18. MasterDataAgentController - Master data agent operations
19. UserAssetLinkAgentController - User asset link agent operations
20. AuditAgentController - Audit logging and tracking

**Features:**
- All endpoints from all 20 controllers
- Organized by controller structure
- Environment and global variables properly configured
- Comprehensive request examples
- Consistent variable naming (assetbaseUrl)

**Environment Variables:**
See Asset_Service_Consolidated_Environment.postman_environment.json for all 39 environment variables.

formdata.description: Make ID (optional, will use make from model if not provided)
Purchase and Installation Date (required, format: yyyy-MM-dd)
Limited Warranty end date (required, format: yyyy-MM-dd)
Upload Purchase Invoice - Document file (PDF, image, etc.) - Optional

request.description:
Create a complete asset with all related information in one request.

**Request Parts:**
1. `request` (JSON): Complete asset creation request
2. `purchaseInvoice` (File): Optional purchase invoice document

**Request Body Fields:**
- **User Context:**
  - `userId`: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
  - `username`: Caller username ({{username}})
  - `projectType`: Project type (default: ASSET_SERVICE)

- **Asset Basic Information:**
  - `assetNameUdv`: Title/UI Name (required)
  - `modelId`: Model Number (required)
  - `serialNumber`: Serial Number (optional)
  - `categoryId`: Category ID (optional)
  - `subCategoryId`: SubCategory ID (optional)
  - `makeId`: Make ID (optional, will use make from model if not provided)
  - `assetStatus`: Asset status (optional, e.g., ACTIVE, INACTIVE)

- **Warranty Information:**
  - `warrantyStartDate`: Purchase and Installation Date (required, format: yyyy-MM-dd)
  - `warrantyEndDate`: Limited Warranty end date (required, format: yyyy-MM-dd)
  - `warrantyProvider`: Warranty provider name (optional)
  - `warrantyStatus`: Warranty status (optional, default: ACTIVE)
  - `warrantyTerms`: Warranty terms/description (optional)

- **User Assignment:**
  - `targetUserId`: Added to - User ID to assign asset to (required)
  - `targetUsername`: Added to - Username (optional, will be derived if not provided)

**Response Structure:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "✅ Asset created successfully with warranty, document, and user assignment",
  "data": {
    "assetId": 123,
    "assetNameUdv": "Laptop-Dell-XPS13-001",
    "serialNumber": "SN123456789",
    "purchaseDate": "2024-01-15",
    "modelId": 5,
    "modelName": "XPS 13",
    "categoryId": 1,
    "categoryName": "Electronics",
    "subCategoryId": 1,
    "subCategoryName": "Laptops",
    "makeId": 1,
    "makeName": "Dell",
    "assetStatus": "ACTIVE",
    "warrantyId": 456,
    "warrantyStartDate": "2024-01-15",
    "warrantyEndDate": "2025-01-15",
    "warrantyProvider": "Dell Inc.",
    "warrantyStatus": "ACTIVE",
    "documentId": 789,
    "documentFileName": "invoice.pdf",
    "documentFilePath": "/uploads/documents/invoice.pdf",
    "targetUserId": 100,
    "targetUsername": "john.doe",
    "linkStatus": "linked"
  }
}
```

**What This Endpoint Does:**
1. ✅ Creates asset with provided information
2. ✅ Sets serial number and purchase date
3. ✅ Creates warranty with start/end dates
4. ✅ Uploads purchase invoice document (if provided)
5. ✅ Links asset to target user
6. ✅ All operations in a single transaction (atomic)

**Error Handling:**
- If any step fails, the entire transaction is rolled back
- Returns detailed error messages for validation failures

Create a complete asset without uploading a purchase invoice document.

**Note:** The `purchaseInvoice` part is omitted. All other operations (asset creation, warranty creation, user assignment) will still be performed.

formdata.description: Purchase and Installation Date (required, format: yyyy-MM-dd)
Limited Warranty end date (required, format: yyyy-MM-dd)

request.description:
Create asset with minimal required fields only.

**Required Fields:**
- `userId`: Caller user ID
- `username`: Caller username
- `assetNameUdv`: Asset name/title
- `modelId`: Model ID
- `warrantyStartDate`: Warranty start date
- `warrantyEndDate`: Warranty end date
- `targetUserId`: User ID to assign asset to

**Optional Fields (will use defaults if not provided):**
- `serialNumber`: Will be null if not provided
- `categoryId`, `subCategoryId`, `makeId`: Will be derived from model if not provided
- `warrantyProvider`, `warrantyStatus`, `warrantyTerms`: Will use defaults
- `purchaseInvoice`: Document upload is optional

formdata.value: Standard manufacturer warranty covering parts and labor for 1 year from purchase date. Includes on-site service for business customers.

formdata.description: Upload Purchase Invoice - Document file (PDF, image, etc.)

request.description:
Full example with all fields populated and document upload.

**Example Values:**
- Asset Name: "Laptop-Dell-XPS13-2024-001"
- Serial Number: "DLXPS13-2024-001-SN123456789"
- Model ID: 5
- Warranty: 1 year (2024-01-15 to 2025-01-15)
- Target User: john.doe (ID: 123)

**Use this as a template and replace with your actual values.**
Upload Excel file for bulk category creation

Link an ASSET to a user. Supports universal entity linking for ASSET, COMPONENT, MODEL, MAKE, AMC, WARRANTY, DOCUMENT.

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
- username: Caller username ({{username}})
- entityType: Entity type - ASSET, COMPONENT, MODEL, MAKE, AMC, WARRANTY, DOCUMENT
- entityId: ID of the entity to link (use {{assetId}}, {{componentId}}, etc.)
- targetUserId: Target user ID to link the entity to ({{targetUserId}})
- targetUsername: Target username ({{targetUsername}})

**Example Entity Types:**
- ASSET: Link an asset to a user
- COMPONENT: Link a component to a user
- MODEL: Link a model to a user
- MAKE: Link a make to a user
- AMC: Link an AMC to a user
- WARRANTY: Link a warranty to a user
- DOCUMENT: Link a document to a user
Link a COMPONENT to a user using the universal link endpoint.
Link a MODEL to a user using the universal link endpoint.
Link a MAKE to a user using the universal link endpoint.
Link an AMC to a user using the universal link endpoint.
Link a WARRANTY to a user using the universal link endpoint.
Link a DOCUMENT to a user using the universal link endpoint.

Delink an ASSET from a user. Supports universal entity delinking for ASSET, COMPONENT, MODEL, MAKE, AMC, WARRANTY, DOCUMENT.

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
- username: Caller username ({{username}})
- entityType: Entity type - ASSET, COMPONENT, MODEL, MAKE, AMC, WARRANTY, DOCUMENT
- entityId: ID of the entity to delink (use {{assetId}}, {{componentId}}, etc.)
- targetUserId: Target user ID to delink the entity from ({{targetUserId}})
- targetUsername: Target username ({{targetUsername}})

**Note:** The entity must be currently linked to the target user for delinking to succeed.
Delink a COMPONENT from a user using the universal delink endpoint.
Delink a MODEL from a user using the universal delink endpoint.
Delink a MAKE from a user using the universal delink endpoint.
Delink an AMC from a user using the universal delink endpoint.
Delink a WARRANTY from a user using the universal delink endpoint.
Delink a DOCUMENT from a user using the universal delink endpoint.

Link a user to multiple entities in a single request using typed fields.

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
- username: Caller username ({{username}})
- targetUserId: Target user ID to link entities to ({{targetUserId}})
- targetUsername: Target username ({{targetUsername}})
- assetId: Asset ID to link ({{assetId}})
- componentId: Component ID to link ({{componentId}})
- modelId: Model ID to link ({{modelId}})
- makeId: Make ID to link ({{makeId}})
- amcId: AMC ID to link ({{amcId}})
- warrantyId: Warranty ID to link ({{warrantyId}})
- documentId: Document ID to link ({{documentId}})

**Note:** All entity ID fields are optional. Provide only the IDs you want to link.

Link a user to multiple entities using the string format (backward compatible).

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
- username: Caller username ({{username}})
- targetUserId: Target user ID ({{targetUserId}})
- targetUsername: Target username ({{targetUsername}})
- entityLinks: Array of strings in format "TYPE:ID" (e.g., ["ASSET:1", "COMPONENT:2"])

**String Format Examples:**
- "ASSET:1001" - Link asset with ID 1001
- "COMPONENT:501" - Link component with ID 501
- "MODEL:201" - Link model with ID 201
- "MAKE:101" - Link make with ID 101
- "AMC:301" - Link AMC with ID 301
- "WARRANTY:401" - Link warranty with ID 401
- "DOCUMENT:701" - Link document with ID 701

Delink a user from multiple entities in a single request using typed fields.

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
- username: Caller username ({{username}})
- targetUserId: Target user ID to delink entities from ({{targetUserId}})
- targetUsername: Target username ({{targetUsername}})
- assetId: Asset ID to delink ({{assetId}})
- componentId: Component ID to delink ({{componentId}})
- modelId: Model ID to delink ({{modelId}})
- makeId: Make ID to delink ({{makeId}})
- amcId: AMC ID to delink ({{amcId}})
- warrantyId: Warranty ID to delink ({{warrantyId}})
- documentId: Document ID to delink ({{documentId}})

**Note:** All entity ID fields are optional. Provide only the IDs you want to delink.

Delink a user from multiple entities using the string format (backward compatible).

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: Caller user ID ({{userId}})
- username: Caller username ({{username}})
- targetUserId: Target user ID ({{targetUserId}})
- targetUsername: Target username ({{targetUsername}})
- entityLinks: Array of strings in format "TYPE:ID" (e.g., ["ASSET:1", "COMPONENT:2"])

**String Format Examples:**
- "ASSET:1001" - Delink asset with ID 1001
- "COMPONENT:501" - Delink component with ID 501
- "MODEL:201" - Delink model with ID 201
- "MAKE:101" - Delink make with ID 101
- "AMC:301" - Delink AMC with ID 301
- "WARRANTY:401" - Delink warranty with ID 401
- "DOCUMENT:701" - Delink document with ID 701

query.description: Target user ID to get assigned assets for

request.description:
Get all assets assigned to a specific user.

**Query Parameters:**
- targetUserId: Target user ID ({{targetUserId}}) - Required

**Response:** Returns a list of all assets (and other entities) assigned to the target user.

query.description: Asset ID to get link information for (optional)
Component ID to get link information for (optional)

request.description:
Get link information for a single asset or component.

**Query Parameters:**
- assetId: Asset ID ({{assetId}}) - Optional, provide either assetId or componentId
- componentId: Component ID ({{componentId}}) - Optional, provide either assetId or componentId

**Note:** At least one of assetId or componentId must be provided.

query.description: SubCategory ID to get users for

request.description:
Get all users linked to assets in a specific subcategory.

**Query Parameters:**
- subCategoryId: SubCategory ID ({{subCategoryId}}) - Required

**Response:** Returns a list of users who have assets assigned in the specified subcategory.

header.description: JWT Bearer token from auth-service. The token is used to extract login userId and username for audit purposes.

request.description:
Get comprehensive master data including all entities:
- Users (from asset user links)
- Assets (with category, subcategory, make, model, status)
- Components
- Warranties (with asset details, dates, provider, status, terms)
- AMCs (with asset details, dates, status)
- Makes (with subcategory info)
- Models (with make info)
- Categories
- Sub-categories (with category info)
- Vendors (with contact details, address)
- Outlets (with address, contact info, vendor info)
- Statuses (with code, description, category)
- Summary counts for all entities
- Audit information (login userId, login username, requestedAt)

**Response includes:**
- All master data entities with detailed information
- Summary counts for quick overview
- Audit trail with login user information

item.name: Get Master Data by User ID

header.description: JWT Bearer token from auth-service. The token is used to extract login userId and username for audit purposes.

query.description: User ID to filter master data. Returns only data related to this user.

request.description:
Get comprehensive master data filtered by a specific user ID.

**Query Parameters:**
- userId: User ID to filter data ({{targetUserId}}) - Required

**Returns only data related to the specified user:**
- User information for the specified user
- Assets assigned to the user
- Components assigned to the user
- Warranties for the user's assets
- AMCs for the user's assets
- Makes/Models/Categories/Sub-categories of the user's assets
- Vendors/Outlets related to the user's assets (if applicable)
- Statuses used by the user's assets
- Summary counts for filtered entities
- Audit information (login userId, login username, requestedAt, filteredByUserId)

**Example:** Use targetUserId variable (e.g., 123) to get all master data for that user.

header.description: JWT Bearer token from auth-service. The token is used to extract login userId and username for audit purposes.

request.description:
Get comprehensive master data including all entities:
- Users (from asset user links)
- Assets (with category, subcategory, make, model, status)
- Components
- Warranties (with asset details, dates, provider, status, terms)
- AMCs (with asset details, dates, status)
- Makes (with subcategory info)
- Models (with make info)
- Categories
- Sub-categories (with category info)
- Vendors (with contact details, address)
- Outlets (with address, contact info, vendor info)
- Statuses (with code, description, category)
- Summary counts for all entities
- Audit information (login userId, login username, requestedAt)

**Response Structure:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "All master data retrieved successfully",
  "data": {
    "users": [...],
    "assets": [...],
    "components": [...],
    "warranties": [...],
    "amcs": [...],
    "makes": [...],
    "models": [...],
    "categories": [...],
    "subCategories": [...],
    "vendors": [...],
    "outlets": [...],
    "statuses": [...],
    "summary": {
      "totalUsers": 10,
      "totalAssets": 50,
      "totalComponents": 20,
      ...
    },
    "audit": {
      "loginUserId": 123,
      "loginUsername": "john.doe",
      "requestedAt": "2024-01-15T10:30:00"
    }
  }
}
```

**Note:** This endpoint returns ALL master data without filtering. Use the filtered endpoint if you need data for a specific user.

item.name: Get Master Data Filtered by User ID

header.description: JWT Bearer token from auth-service. The token is used to extract login userId and username for audit purposes.

query.description:
User ID to filter master data. Returns only data related to this user:
- User information for this user
- Assets assigned to this user
- Components assigned to this user
- Warranties for this user's assets
- AMCs for this user's assets
- Makes/Models/Categories/Sub-categories of this user's assets
- Statuses used by this user's assets

request.description:
Get comprehensive master data filtered by a specific user ID.

**Query Parameters:**
- userId: User ID to filter data ({{userId}}) - Required

**Returns only data related to the specified user:**
- User information for the specified user
- Assets assigned to the user
- Components assigned to the user
- Warranties for the user's assets
- AMCs for the user's assets
- Makes/Models/Categories/Sub-categories of the user's assets
- Vendors/Outlets related to the user's assets (if applicable)
- Statuses used by the user's assets
- Summary counts for filtered entities
- Audit information (login userId, login username, requestedAt, filteredByUserId)

**Response Structure:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Master data retrieved successfully for user ID: 123",
  "data": {
    "users": [
      {
        "userId": 123,
        "username": "john.doe",
        "email": "john@example.com",
        "mobile": "+1234567890",
        "assignedDate": "2024-01-10T09:00:00",
        "unassignedDate": null
      }
    ],
    "assets": [
      {
        "assetId": 1,
        "assetNameUdv": "Laptop-001",
        "assetStatus": "ACTIVE",
        "categoryId": 1,
        "categoryName": "Electronics",
        "subCategoryId": 1,
        "subCategoryName": "Laptops",
        "makeId": 1,
        "makeName": "Dell",
        "modelId": 1,
        "modelName": "XPS 13",
        "active": true,
        "createdBy": "admin",
        "createdAt": "2024-01-01T00:00:00",
        "updatedBy": "admin",
        "updatedAt": "2024-01-01T00:00:00"
      }
    ],
    "components": [...],
    "warranties": [...],
    "amcs": [...],
    "makes": [...],
    "models": [...],
    "categories": [...],
    "subCategories": [...],
    "vendors": [...],
    "outlets": [...],
    "statuses": [...],
    "summary": {
      "totalUsers": 1,
      "totalAssets": 5,
      "totalComponents": 2,
      ...
    },
    "audit": {
      "loginUserId": 456,
      "loginUsername": "admin",
      "requestedAt": "2024-01-15T10:30:00",
      "filteredByUserId": 123
    }
  }
}
```

**Example Usage:**
- Get all data for user ID 123: `?userId=123`
- The login user (from token) making the request is tracked in the audit section
- The filtered user ID is also included in the audit section

item.name: Get Master Data Filtered by User ID (Example)

query.description: Example: Get master data for user ID 123

request.description: Example request to get master data for user ID 123. Replace 123 with the actual user ID you want to query.

header.description: JWT Bearer token from auth-service. The token is used to extract login userId and username for audit purposes.

request.description:
Get comprehensive 'Need Your Attention' data including all entities in detail with attention indicators.

**This endpoint returns:**
- **All Master Data:**
  - Users (from asset user links)
  - Assets (with category, subcategory, make, model, status, serial number, purchase date)
  - Components
  - Warranties (with asset details, dates, provider, status, terms)
  - AMCs (with asset details, dates, status)
  - Makes (with subcategory info)
  - Models (with make info)
  - Categories
  - Sub-categories (with category info)
  - Vendors (with contact details, address)
  - Outlets (with address, contact info, vendor info)
  - Statuses (with code, description, category)

- **Summary Counts:**
  - Total counts for all entity types

- **Attention Indicators:**
  - `expiringWarranties`: Warranties expiring within 30 days
  - `expiringWarrantiesCount`: Count of expiring warranties
  - `expiringAmcs`: AMCs expiring within 30 days
  - `expiringAmcsCount`: Count of expiring AMCs
  - `assetsWithoutWarranty`: Assets that don't have a warranty
  - `assetsWithoutWarrantyCount`: Count of assets without warranty
  - `assetsWithoutAmc`: Assets that don't have an AMC
  - `assetsWithoutAmcCount`: Count of assets without AMC
  - `unassignedAssets`: Assets not assigned to any user
  - `unassignedAssetsCount`: Count of unassigned assets

- **Audit Information:**
  - loginUserId, loginUsername, requestedAt, requestType

**Response Structure:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Need Your Attention data retrieved successfully",
  "data": {
    "users": [...],
    "assets": [...],
    "components": [...],
    "warranties": [...],
    "amcs": [...],
    "makes": [...],
    "models": [...],
    "categories": [...],
    "subCategories": [...],
    "vendors": [...],
    "outlets": [...],
    "statuses": [...],
    "summary": {
      "totalUsers": 10,
      "totalAssets": 50,
      "totalComponents": 20,
      "totalWarranties": 30,
      "totalAmcs": 15,
      ...
    },
    "attention": {
      "expiringWarranties": [...],
      "expiringWarrantiesCount": 5,
      "expiringAmcs": [...],
      "expiringAmcsCount": 3,
      "assetsWithoutWarranty": [...],
      "assetsWithoutWarrantyCount": 10,
      "assetsWithoutAmc": [...],
      "assetsWithoutAmcCount": 8,
      "unassignedAssets": [...],
      "unassignedAssetsCount": 12
    },
    "audit": {
      "loginUserId": 123,
      "loginUsername": "admin",
      "requestedAt": "2024-01-15T10:30:00",
      "requestType": "NEED_YOUR_ATTENTION"
    }
  }
}
```

**Use Cases:**
- Dashboard overview showing all entities
- Identifying items that need attention (expiring warranties, unassigned assets, etc.)
- Comprehensive data export
- System health monitoring
- Reporting and analytics

Create a new warranty record for an asset or component.

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: User ID ({{userId}}) - Required
- username: Username ({{username}}) - Required
- projectType: Project type ({{projectType}}) - Optional
- assetId: Asset ID ({{assetId}}) - Required
- componentId: Component ID ({{componentId}}) - Optional
- warrantyStatus: Warranty status ({{warrantyStatus}}) - Required
- warrantyProvider: Warranty provider name ({{warrantyProvider}}) - Optional
- warrantyTerms: Warranty terms description ({{warrantyTerms}}) - Optional
- startDate: Warranty start date ({{startDate}}) - Required, format: yyyy-MM-dd
- endDate: Warranty end date ({{endDate}}) - Required, format: yyyy-MM-dd
- documentId: Document ID for warranty document ({{documentId}}) - Optional
- docType: Document type ({{docType}}) - Optional

**Note:** Document uploads are handled separately via DocumentController.

Update an existing warranty record.

**Path Parameters:**
- warrantyId: Warranty ID ({{warrantyId}}) - Required

**Request Body Variables:**
Same as Create Warranty. All fields are optional for update, but provide the fields you want to update.

Soft delete a warranty record.

**Path Parameters:**
- warrantyId: Warranty ID ({{warrantyId}}) - Required

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: User ID ({{userId}}) - Required
- username: Username ({{username}}) - Required
- projectType: Project type ({{projectType}}) - Optional

**Note:** This performs a soft delete, marking the warranty as inactive rather than removing it from the database.

Get all warranty records.

**Response:** Returns a list of all warranty records with their details.

Get a specific warranty record by ID.

**Path Parameters:**
- warrantyId: Warranty ID ({{warrantyId}}) - Required

**Response:** Returns warranty details if found, 404 if not found.

Create a new AMC (Annual Maintenance Contract) record for an asset or component.

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: User ID ({{userId}}) - Optional
- username: Username ({{username}}) - Optional
- projectType: Project type ({{projectType}}) - Optional
- assetId: Asset ID ({{assetId}}) - Optional
- componentId: Component ID ({{componentId}}) - Optional
- amcStatus: AMC status ({{amcStatus}}) - Optional
- startDate: AMC start date ({{startDate}}) - Optional, format: yyyy-MM-dd
- endDate: AMC end date ({{endDate}}) - Optional, format: yyyy-MM-dd
- documentId: Document ID for AMC document ({{documentId}}) - Optional
- docType: Document type ({{docType}}) - Optional

**Note:** Document uploads are handled separately via DocumentController.

Update an existing AMC record.

**Path Parameters:**
- amcId: AMC ID ({{amcId}}) - Required

**Request Body Variables:**
Same as Create AMC. All fields are optional for update, but provide the fields you want to update.

Soft delete an AMC record.

**Path Parameters:**
- amcId: AMC ID ({{amcId}}) - Required

**Request Body Variables:**
- userId: User ID ({{userId}}) - Optional
- username: Username ({{username}}) - Optional
- projectType: Project type ({{projectType}}) - Optional

**Note:** This performs a soft delete, marking the AMC as inactive rather than removing it from the database.

Get all AMC records.

**Response:** Returns a list of all AMC records with their details.

Get a specific AMC record by ID.

**Path Parameters:**
- amcId: AMC ID ({{amcId}}) - Required

**Response:** Returns AMC details if found, 404 if not found.

variable.description: Base URL for Asset Service API

JWT Bearer token obtained from auth-service login endpoint.

**How to get:**
1. Login to auth-service using POST /api/auth/login
2. Copy the accessToken from the response
3. Set this variable with the token value (without 'Bearer ' prefix)

**Format:** The token will be automatically prefixed with 'Bearer ' in the Authorization header.
Caller user ID (the user making the request). Used for audit purposes.
Caller username (the user making the request). Used for audit purposes.
Category ID (optional). Must be a valid category ID from the product_category table.
Make ID (optional). If not provided, will use the make from the model. Must be a valid make ID from the product_make table.
Model ID (Model Number). Required field. Must be a valid model ID from the product_model table.
SubCategory ID (optional). Must be a valid subcategory ID from the product_sub_category table.
Target user ID (Added to). Required field. The user ID to assign the asset to.
Target username (Added to). Optional. If not provided, will be derived as 'user_{targetUserId}'.
